entry.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

entry.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.

entry.title: Ceinsys Tech Seeks NSE Listing to Broaden Investor Base and Enhance Visibility (Scanx – Corporate Actions)
entry.content:
Top News
Ceinsys Tech Seeks NSE Listing to Broaden Investor Base and Enhance Visibility 4 hours ago
Ceinsys Tech Limited, currently listed on BSE, has applied for listing on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on December 6, 2025. The company's financial position shows significant year-over-year improvements. Total assets increased by 77.15% to ₹577.70 crore, current assets grew by 94.71% to ₹445.70 crore, total equity rose by 75.95% to ₹411.90 crore, and fixed assets expanded by 82.23% to ₹80.00 crore. The NSE listing aims to widen investor participation and improve visibility of the company's equity shares.

entry.title: Sasken Technologies Faces Rs 45.29 Crore GST Demand After Appeal Dismissal (Scanx – Corporate Actions)
entry.content:
Sasken Technologies Faces Rs 45.29 Crore GST Demand After Appeal Dismissal 5 hours ago
Sasken Technologies Limited received orders dismissing its appeals for FY 2017-18 and 2018-19, confirming GST demands totaling Rs 45.29 crore. The demands relate to alleged violations on reverse charge payments to overseas branches. For FY 2017-18, the demand is Rs 20.75 crore, and for FY 2018-19, it's Rs 24.54 crore. The company states no material impact on its operations and plans to appeal before the Goods and Services Tax Appellate Tribunal (GSTAT).

entry.title: Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission (Scanx – Corporate Actions)
entry.content:
Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission 6 hours ago
Hardwyn India Limited addressed the delay in submitting its financial results for Q3 2025 ending September 30. The company cited multiple board meeting adjournments due to lack of quorum, unforeseen circumstances, and the need for financial figure reconciliation. The statutory auditors required additional time for review. The board meeting was finally conducted on November 19, 2025, with results submitted thereafter. Hardwyn emphasized the delay was unintentional and reaffirmed its commitment to regulatory compliance.

entry.title: Ace Software Exports Secures Major AI-Driven Mortgage Platform Deal (Scanx – Earnings)
entry.content:
Ace Software Exports Secures Major AI-Driven Mortgage Platform Deal 1 hour ago
Ace Software Exports Limited has landed a multi-phase product engineering contract worth approximately $1.5 million (INR 13.49 Crore) in the AI-driven mortgage marketplace sector. The initial purchase order is $48,000 for the MVP phase. The project involves developing an AI-driven mortgage marketplace platform for a US-based private equity firm, using a dedicated Global Capability Centre (GCC) delivery model. This engagement comes as the company reports significant financial growth, with total assets increasing by 168.14% and shareholders' capital by 185.04% over the past year.

entry.title: Sasken Technologies Faces Rs 45.29 Crore GST Demand After Appeal Dismissal (Scanx – Orders & Deals)
entry.content:
Sasken Technologies Faces Rs 45.29 Crore GST Demand After Appeal Dismissal 5 hours ago
Sasken Technologies Limited received orders dismissing its appeals for FY 2017-18 and 2018-19, confirming GST demands totaling Rs 45.29 crore. The demands relate to alleged violations on reverse charge payments to overseas branches. For FY 2017-18, the demand is Rs 20.75 crore, and for FY 2018-19, it's Rs 24.54 crore. The company states no material impact on its operations and plans to appeal before the Goods and Services Tax Appellate Tribunal (GSTAT).

entry.title: Ceinsys Tech Seeks NSE Listing to Broaden Investor Base and Enhance Visibility (Scanx – Orders & Deals)
entry.content:
Ceinsys Tech Seeks NSE Listing to Broaden Investor Base and Enhance Visibility 4 hours ago
Ceinsys Tech Limited, currently listed on BSE, has applied for listing on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on December 6, 2025. The company's financial position shows significant year-over-year improvements. Total assets increased by 77.15% to ₹577.70 crore, current assets grew by 94.71% to ₹445.70 crore, total equity rose by 75.95% to ₹411.90 crore, and fixed assets expanded by 82.23% to ₹80.00 crore. The NSE listing aims to widen investor participation and improve visibility of the company's equity shares.

entry.content:
Ace Software Exports Secures Major AI-Driven Mortgage Platform Deal 1 hour ago
Ace Software Exports Limited has landed a multi-phase product engineering contract worth approximately $1.5 million (INR 13.49 Crore) in the AI-driven mortgage marketplace sector. The initial purchase order is $48,000 for the MVP phase. The project involves developing an AI-driven mortgage marketplace platform for a US-based private equity firm, using a dedicated Global Capability Centre (GCC) delivery model. This engagement comes as the company reports significant financial growth, with total assets increasing by 168.14% and shareholders' capital by 185.04% over the past year.

entry.title: Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission (Scanx – Markets)
entry.content:
Hardwyn India Limited Explains Delay in Q2 FY2026 Financial Results Submission 6 hours ago
Hardwyn India Limited addressed the delay in submitting its financial results for Q3 2025 ending September 30. The company cited multiple board meeting adjournments due to lack of quorum, unforeseen circumstances, and the need for financial figure reconciliation. The statutory auditors required additional time for review. The board meeting was finally conducted on November 19, 2025, with results submitted thereafter. Hardwyn emphasized the delay was unintentional and reaffirmed its commitment to regulatory compliance.

The company's financial data shows growth, with total assets increasing by 5.22% to ₹308,847.00 crore and investments growing by 4.92% to ₹304,054.00 crore over the past year. The IPO is expected to attract significant investor interest due to the company's strong market position in India's asset management industry.

entry.content: Sector Performance Snapshot: Banking, Finance, and IT Lead Gains Amid Mixed Market Sentiment

entry.title: undefined (MarketsMojo – Stock Market News)
entry.content: The Indian equity market displayed a broadly positive tone on 5 December 2025, with 27 sectors advancing against 9 declining, resulting in a sector advance-decline ratio of 3.0. The BSE 500 index recorded a one-day return of 0.39%, reflecting cautious optimism among investors. Notably, the NIFTYPSUBANK, NIFTYFINANCE, and NIFTYIT sectors emerged as the top gainers, buoyed by strong performances from key stocks such as SBI, Cholaman Investment & Finance, and HCL Technologies. Conversely, sectors like NIFTYMEDIA, BSE Capital Goods, and S&P Industrials faced downward pressure, influenced by significant declines in select heavyweight stocks.
